propulsion_systems.name: Propulsion Systems
propulsion_systems.description: Research improving propulsion efficiency reduces energy costs for orbital access, building, and resource collection. Each upgrade improves dexterity energy efficiency.

tiers.name: Hydrazine Rockets
tiers.description: Basic monopropellant hydrazine rocket systems. Provides simple, reliable thrust for orbital maneuvers. Reduces energy cost for accessing higher orbits and using dexterity for operations.

tiers.name: Hydrogen Rockets
tiers.description: High-efficiency liquid hydrogen-oxygen rocket engines. Superior specific impulse compared to hydrazine, reducing propellant mass requirements.

tiers.name: Methalox Rockets
tiers.description: Methane-oxygen rocket engines optimized for in-situ resource utilization. Can be refueled using local materials, reducing logistics costs.

tiers.name: Vacuum-Rated Nozzles
tiers.description: Optimized rocket nozzles designed for vacuum operation. Maximum expansion ratio extracts every joule of energy from propellant exhaust.

tiers.name: Thermal Fission Drive
tiers.description: Nuclear thermal propulsion using fission reactor heat to expel propellant at extreme velocities. Massive improvement in specific impulse and thrust.

tiers.name: FRC Fusion Drive
tiers.description: Field-Reversed Configuration fusion drive. Compact toroidal plasma configuration enables efficient fusion propulsion with high power density.

tiers.name: Magnetic Mirror Fusion Drive
tiers.description: Advanced magnetic mirror confinement for fusion propulsion. Superior plasma stability and exhaust control enable precise thrust management.

tiers.name: Electrostatic Inertial Confinement Fusion Drive
tiers.description: Fusion propulsion using electrostatic forces for inertial confinement. Eliminates massive magnetic coils, reducing system mass dramatically.

tiers.name: Antimatter-Matter Drive
tiers.description: Ultimate chemical propulsion using matter-antimatter annihilation. Maximum energy density release provides near-light-speed exhaust velocities.

tiers.name: Magnetohydrodynamic Inertial Mass Reduction Drive
tiers.description: Revolutionary propulsion system manipulating spacetime geometry to reduce effective inertial mass. Enables rapid acceleration with minimal energy expenditure.

locomotion_systems.name: Locomotion Systems
locomotion_systems.description: Research improving fine movement and positioning systems reduces energy costs for building and mining, while increasing carrying capacity at each orbital altitude.

tiers.name: Cold Gas Thrusters
tiers.description: Simple compressed gas thrusters for precise attitude control and small movements. Low complexity, reliable fine positioning.

tiers.name: Hall Effect Thrusters
tiers.description: Electric propulsion using crossed electric and magnetic fields to accelerate ions. High efficiency for continuous operation and precise control.

tiers.name: Heavy Ion Thrusters
tiers.description: Advanced ion engines using heavier ions for increased thrust density. Superior power-to-thrust ratio enables higher acceleration rates.

tiers.name: Plasma RF Thrusters
tiers.description: Radio frequency antennas ionize and accelerate propellant without electrodes. Eliminates erosion, enabling extremely long operational lifetimes.

tiers.name: EM Drive Momentum Conserver
tiers.description: Controversial but effective electromagnetic drive that appears to violate conservation of momentum. Provides reactionless thrust through quantum vacuum fluctuations.

tiers.name: Quantized Inertial Capacitor Bank
tiers.description: Energy storage system that exploits quantum mechanical properties to store inertial energy. Enables rapid energy release for high-impulse maneuvers.

tiers.name: Casimir Microstructure Surface Array
tiers.description: Nano-engineered surfaces exploiting Casimir forces for micro-positioning. Enables atomic-scale precision in movement and manipulation.

tiers.name: Unruh Horizon Higgs Attractor
tiers.description: Ultimate locomotion system manipulating Higgs field interactions through Unruh radiation effects. Enables movement that appears to violate conservation laws through fundamental field manipulation.

acds.name: Attitude Control and Determination Systems
acds.description: ACDS research increases mining and building rates while lowering dexterity energy costs. Advanced control systems enable precise probe positioning and orientation.

tiers.name: Gravity Boom
tiers.description: Simple extendable boom creating gravity gradient for passive attitude stabilization. Low-energy method for maintaining orientation using tidal forces.

tiers.name: Magnetorquer
tiers.description: Magnetic coils interacting with planetary and solar magnetic fields for attitude control. Efficient torque generation without propellant expenditure.

tiers.name: Reaction Wheel
tiers.description: Spinning flywheels storing angular momentum for precise attitude control. Enables fine orientation adjustments without external forces.

tiers.name: Solar Sail
tiers.description: Large reflective surfaces using photon pressure for propulsion and attitude control. Provides continuous acceleration and orientation control from sunlight.

tiers.name: Spin-Polaron Field Effect Emitter
tiers.description: Advanced system manipulating electron spin states to create controllable fields for attitude control. Quantum-mechanical orientation management.

tiers.name: Einstein-Cartan Torsion Array
tiers.description: Control system exploiting spacetime torsion in Einstein-Cartan theory. Enables attitude control through geometric manipulation of spacetime itself.

tiers.name: Mach Effector
tiers.description: Attitude control system based on Mach's principle, manipulating inertial frame interactions. Controls orientation through universe-scale field interactions.

tiers.name: Invariant Manifold Attractors
tiers.description: Ultimate control system using invariant manifolds in phase space to maintain stable orientations. Exploits nonlinear dynamics for perfect attitude stability.

robotic_systems.name: Robotic Systems
robotic_systems.description: Research improving robotic manipulation capabilities increases mining and building rates while lowering dexterity energy costs. Better tools and control systems enable more efficient operations.

tiers.name: Manipulator Arms
tiers.description: Basic robotic arms with multiple degrees of freedom for grasping and manipulation. Essential for construction and mining operations.

tiers.name: End-Effectors
tiers.description: Specialized tool heads for different tasks - drills, grippers, welders, cutters. Optimized end-effectors dramatically improve task-specific efficiency.

tiers.name: Modular Tool Heads
tiers.description: Rapid-swap tool head system allowing single arm to use multiple specialized tools. Eliminates need for separate tools per task, improving versatility.

tiers.name: Deformable Surface Controllers
tiers.description: Advanced manipulation systems with soft, deformable surfaces that adapt to object geometry. Enables secure grasping of irregular shapes and fragile materials.

tiers.name: Metal-Liquid Interface Manipulators
tiers.description: Specialized systems for working with molten metals and liquid materials. Enables direct manipulation of materials in liquid state during manufacturing.

tiers.name: Magnetic Vacuum Arrays
tiers.description: Magnetic field manipulation systems for non-contact material handling in vacuum. Enables precise control of metallic objects without physical contact.

tiers.name: Zero-Point Field Disruptors
tiers.description: Ultimate manipulation systems that directly interact with zero-point field fluctuations. Enables matter manipulation at quantum level with minimal energy expenditure.

computer_systems.name: Computer Systems
computer_systems.description: Research improving computational capabilities increases dexterity, decreases energy costs for all probes, provides slight factory production bonuses, and increases computing output per percentage of Dyson swarm completed.

processing.name: Processing
processing.description: Central processing unit improvements increase computational power and efficiency.

tiers.name: Edge Compute Node
tiers.description: Distributed computing nodes at probe edge for local processing. Reduces latency and enables autonomous decision-making without central coordination.

tiers.name: FPGA Array
tiers.description: Field-programmable gate arrays optimized for specific tasks. Reconfigurable hardware enables maximum efficiency for different computational workloads.

tiers.name: ASIC Interconnect
tiers.description: Application-specific integrated circuits with optimized interconnects. Custom silicon for maximum performance in specific algorithms.

tiers.name: Silicon Photonic Interconnect
tiers.description: Optical interconnects using silicon photonics for ultra-fast data transfer between processing units. Eliminates electrical bottlenecks.

tiers.name: Optimized Tensor Core
tiers.description: Specialized processing units for tensor operations. Accelerates machine learning, simulation, and complex mathematical computations.

tiers.name: Photonic Tensor Array
tiers.description: Optical tensor processing using photonic circuits. Light-speed computation for matrix operations and neural network inference.

tiers.name: Thermodynamic Sampling Unit
tiers.description: Computational systems exploiting thermodynamic fluctuations for probabilistic sampling. Enables efficient solutions to optimization and sampling problems.

tiers.name: Adiabatic Reversible Compilers
tiers.description: Reversible computing systems that operate adiabatically, minimizing energy dissipation. Theoretical maximum efficiency for computation.

tiers.name: Trapped Rubidium Phased Gate Arrays
tiers.description: Quantum computing systems using trapped rubidium atoms as qubits. Enables quantum algorithms for optimization and simulation.

tiers.name: Neuromorphic Analog CPU
tiers.description: Brain-inspired computing architectures using analog circuits to simulate neural networks. Massive parallelism and energy efficiency for pattern recognition and control.

memory.name: Memory Systems
memory.description: Memory system improvements increase data storage capacity and access speeds.

tiers.name: Heavy-Rad DRAM
tiers.description: Radiation-hardened dynamic random-access memory. Reliable operation in space environment with high radiation exposure.

tiers.name: 1nm Process DRAM
tiers.description: Ultra-dense memory using 1-nanometer fabrication process. Maximum storage density with minimal power consumption.

tiers.name: Quantum Dot DRAM
tiers.description: Memory using quantum dots to store individual bits. Enables single-electron storage and ultra-low power operation.

tiers.name: Neutral Vacancy Diamond Memory
tiers.description: Memory using nitrogen-vacancy centers in diamond. Excellent coherence times and radiation resistance for reliable data storage.

tiers.name: Quantum Dot Memory Array
tiers.description: Large-scale arrays of quantum dots for massive parallel storage. Enables petabyte-scale memory in compact form factors.

tiers.name: DNA/RNA Cold-Storage Array
tiers.description: Biological storage using DNA/RNA molecules for archival data. Extremely high density and longevity for long-term storage.

tiers.name: Condensed Matter Memory Modules
tiers.description: Memory using exotic condensed matter states. Topological states provide robust, error-resistant storage with novel properties.

tiers.name: Compact Bubble Memory Units
tiers.description: Magnetic bubble memory with compact form factor. Non-volatile storage with fast access times and high reliability.

tiers.name: Entangled Memory Gates
tiers.description: Quantum memory using entangled states for distributed storage. Enables quantum error correction and non-local memory access.

tiers.name: Holographic Crystal Read-Outs
tiers.description: Ultimate memory using holographic storage in photonic crystals. Massive storage density with parallel read/write operations.

interface.name: Interface Systems
interface.description: Interface improvements enable better communication between components and systems.

tiers.name: Serial Data Bus
tiers.description: Basic serial communication protocol for data transfer between system components. Simple, reliable point-to-point communication.

tiers.name: Parallel Interconnect
tiers.description: Wide parallel bus architecture for simultaneous data transfer across multiple channels. Dramatically increases bandwidth.

tiers.name: Optical Neural Interface
tiers.description: Optical interfaces mimicking neural connections. High-bandwidth communication using light-based signaling for efficient data transfer.

tiers.name: Quantum Interface Protocol
tiers.description: Communication protocols using quantum entanglement for instant data transfer. Eliminates latency for real-time system coordination.

tiers.name: Telepathic Interface Network
tiers.description: Ultimate interface system using quantum consciousness simulation for direct thought-based communication. Perfect information transfer without translation overhead.

transmission.name: Transmission Systems
transmission.description: Transmission improvements enable faster data communication between probes and systems.

tiers.name: Radio Frequency Link
tiers.description: Basic RF communication for data transmission between probes. Reliable long-range communication using electromagnetic waves.

tiers.name: Laser Communication
tiers.description: Optical communication using focused laser beams. High bandwidth and directional communication for efficient data transfer.

tiers.name: Quantum Entanglement Network
tiers.description: Communication network using quantum-entangled particles. Enables instant information transfer regardless of distance.

tiers.name: Quantum Repeater
tiers.description: Quantum repeaters extend entanglement networks across vast distances. Enables system-wide quantum communication infrastructure.

tiers.name: Entanglement Network
tiers.description: System-wide quantum entanglement network connecting all probes and systems. Perfect synchronization and coordination across the entire swarm.
